ingredients.name: Beef sirloin or ribeye, thinly sliced
Bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs and drumsticks
Italian sausage (mild or hot, casings removed)

recipes.title: Aji de Gallina (Peruvian Creamy Chicken)
recipes.description: A rich and creamy Peruvian chicken stew made with shredded chicken, aji amarillo peppers, walnuts, and cheese, served over potatoes and rice. A comforting and flavorful dinner.

steps.instruction: Boil chicken breasts in salted water until cooked through, about 20 minutes. Remove chicken, let cool, then shred. Reserve 1 cup of chicken broth.
Soak bread slices in 0.5 cup of evaporated milk until soft.

In a large pot or deep skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent, about 8-10 minutes. Add minced garlic and aji amarillo paste, cook for another 5 minutes, stirring constantly.

In a blender, combine the soaked bread (with milk), ground walnuts, grated Parmesan cheese, and the remaining 0.5 cup of evaporated milk. Add 0.5 cup of the reserved chicken broth. Blend until smooth.

Pour the blended sauce into the pot with the onion mixture. Bring to a gentle simmer, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. If the sauce is too thick, add more reserved chicken broth until desired consistency.
Add the shredded chicken to the sauce. Stir well to combine and heat through for 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over sliced boiled potatoes and cooked white rice. Garnish with hard-boiled egg halves and a sprinkle of fresh parsley (optional).

recipes.title: Aloo Tikki Chaat
recipes.description: Crispy potato patties (aloo tikki) topped with spicy chickpeas, tangy chutneys, cool yogurt, and fresh herbs. A delightful and easy Indian street food-inspired lunch.

steps.instruction: Boil and mash the potatoes. In a bowl, combine mashed potatoes with chopped green chilies, cilantro, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well to form a dough-like consistency.
Divide the potato mixture into 8 equal portions and flatten them into round patties (tikkis).
Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Fry the aloo tikkis for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy.
While tikkis are frying, gently warm the chickpeas in a small saucepan or microwave.
To assemble, place 2 crispy aloo tikkis on a serving plate. Top with a spoonful of warm chickpeas.
Drizzle generously with whisked yogurt, tamarind chutney, and mint chutney. Garnish with chopped red onion and extra cilantro.

recipes.title: Assorted Japanese Tempura Platter
recipes.description: Master the art of Japanese tempura with this challenging yet rewarding recipe. Featuring crispy shrimp and a variety of fresh vegetables, served with a delicate dashi-based dipping sauce.

steps.instruction: Prepare shrimp by making 2-3 small slits on the belly side to prevent curling during frying. Pat both shrimp and sliced vegetables thoroughly dry with paper towels.
For the dipping sauce, combine soy sauce, mirin, and dashi stock in a small saucepan. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat, then remove from heat. Set aside to keep warm.

In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and cold water. Gradually add the tempura flour, mixing lightly with chopsticks or a fork until just combined. Do not overmix; a lumpy batter is ideal for a light, crispy texture.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep pot or wok to 340-350°F (170-175°C). Use a thermometer to monitor the temperature accurately.
Working in small batches, lightly dip each piece of shrimp and vegetable into the tempura batter, allowing excess to drip off. Carefully place battered items into the hot oil.

Fry for 2-3 minutes per batch, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy. Do not overcrowd the pot, as this will lower the oil temperature and result in greasy tempura. Remove fried items with a slotted spoon or spider and drain on a wire rack set over paper towels.
Serve the assorted tempura immediately while hot, alongside the warm dipping sauce. Offer grated daikon on the side to mix into the sauce for an authentic touch.

recipes.title: Authentic Brazilian Pão de Queijo
recipes.description: Delicious, chewy, and naturally gluten-free Brazilian cheese bread. Perfect for breakfast or a snack, these Pão de Queijo are easy to make and incredibly addictive.

steps.instruction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a baking sheet or line with parchment paper.
In a medium saucepan, combine the milk, vegetable oil, and salt. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
Remove the saucepan from heat. Add the tapioca flour all at once and stir vigorously with a wooden spoon until a thick, lumpy dough forms. This process is called 'scalding' the flour.
Let the dough cool for about 5-10 minutes. It should be warm to the touch but not hot enough to cook the eggs.
Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition until fully incorporated. The dough will be sticky and elastic.
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese until evenly distributed throughout the dough.
Using lightly oiled hands, roll the dough into small balls, about 1 to 1.5 inches (2.5-4 cm) in diameter. Place them about 1 inch apart on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the Pão de Queijo are puffed up and golden brown. The outside should be slightly crisp, and the inside chewy.
Serve warm and enjoy immediately!

recipes.title: Authentic Chicken Dum Biryani
recipes.description: A rich and aromatic Indian classic featuring tender chicken marinated in spices, layered with fragrant basmati rice, and slow-cooked to perfection. A truly royal feast for dinner.

steps.instruction: Combine chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, turmeric, red chili powder, salt, lemon juice, half of the chopped mint, and cilantro. Mix well and marinate for at least 30 minutes, preferably 2-4 hours in the refrigerator.

Wash basmati rice thoroughly until water runs clear. Soak in water for 30 minutes. Drain. In a large pot, bring plenty of water to a boil with salt and a few whole spices (like bay leaf, cardamom). Add the soaked rice and cook until 70% done. Drain immediately and set aside.

Heat 3 tablespoons of ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven. Add thinly sliced onions and fry on medium-low heat until deep golden brown and crispy (caramelized). Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish.

In the same pot with the remaining fried onions, add the marinated chicken and spread it evenly at the bottom. Layer half of the partially cooked rice over the chicken. Sprinkle with some fried onions, fresh mint, and cilantro. Layer the remaining rice.

Drizzle the remaining ghee, saffron milk, and the remaining fried onions, mint, and cilantro over the top layer of rice. Cover the pot tightly with a lid, sealing the edges with dough if possible (dum style). Cook on high heat for 5 minutes, then reduce heat to low and cook for 25-30 minutes. Let it rest for 10-15 minutes before opening.
Gently mix the biryani from the bottom up to combine the chicken and rice. Serve hot with raita or salad.

recipes.title: Authentic Nigerian Jollof Rice
recipes.description: A classic Nigerian one-pot rice dish, rich in flavor from a vibrant tomato and pepper base, cooked to perfection. A staple for celebrations and everyday meals.

steps.instruction: Blend fresh tomatoes, red bell peppers, scotch bonnet pepper, and half of the onion until smooth. Chop the remaining half onion.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent. Stir in tomato paste and fry for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour the blended pepper mixture into the pot. Cook until the water dries out and the oil floats to the top (about 15-20 minutes), stirring occasionally to prevent burning.
Add chicken stock, seasoning cubes, curry powder, dried thyme, and salt to the stew. Bring to a boil. Add the parboiled rice, stir well, and ensure the liquid just covers the rice.

Cover the pot tightly with aluminum foil and then a lid. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the liquid is absorbed. Do not stir frequently to allow the bottom to caramelize slightly.
Once cooked, remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork and serving.

recipes.title: Authentic Thai Green Curry with Chicken
recipes.description: A vibrant and aromatic Thai green curry featuring tender chicken and crisp vegetables simmered in a rich coconut milk sauce. Perfect for a satisfying dinner.

steps.instruction: Prepare all ingredients: slice chicken, bell pepper, drain bamboo shoots, and wash basil and kaffir lime leaves.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or wok over medium heat. Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces to the pot and stir-fry until lightly browned on all sides, about 3-5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk, add fish sauce, palm sugar, and kaffir lime leaves. Bring to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Add sliced bell pepper and bamboo shoots. Continue to simmer for another 5 minutes, or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in fresh Thai basil leaves just before serving. Remove kaffir lime leaves if desired. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice.

recipes.title: Banh Mi Op La - Vietnamese Fried Eggs with Baguette
recipes.description: A classic Vietnamese breakfast featuring sunny-side-up eggs, savory pork pate, fresh herbs, and a crispy baguette. Quick, flavorful, and satisfying, perfect for a hearty start to your day.

steps.instruction: Prepare fresh ingredients: Slice the cucumber thinly, chop the fresh cilantro, and slice the red chili if using.

Heat cooking oil in a large non-stick pan over medium heat. Crack the eggs directly into the pan, being careful not to break the yolks. Fry until the whites are set and the yolks are still runny (sunny-side up), about 2-3 minutes per batch.
While eggs are cooking, warm the baguettes in a toaster oven or regular oven for a few minutes until crispy. Slice each baguette in half lengthwise, but not all the way through, to create a pocket.
To assemble, spread a generous layer of pork pate inside each warmed baguette half. Place two fried eggs into each baguette. Top with sliced cucumber, chopped cilantro, and sliced red chili.
Drizzle each Banh Mi Op La with soy sauce and Maggi seasoning sauce to taste before serving immediately.

recipes.title: Bratwurst with Sauerkraut and Roasted Potatoes
recipes.description: A classic German comfort meal featuring savory bratwurst sausages, tangy sauerkraut, and tender roasted potatoes, all cooked in one pan for an easy weeknight dinner.

steps.instruction: Peel and dice the potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Slice the yellow onion thinly. Set aside.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the bratwurst sausages and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 6-8 minutes. Remove the bratwurst from the skillet and set aside.

Add the sliced onions to the same skillet and sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the diced potatoes, chicken broth, caraway seeds, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and cook for 10 minutes, or until potatoes are nearly tender.

Stir in the drained sauerkraut and place the browned bratwurst on top of the potato and sauerkraut mixture. Cover and continue to cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the bratwurst is cooked through and the potatoes are fully tender.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve hot, directly from the skillet.

recipes.title: Chicken Teriyaki Donburi
recipes.description: A classic Japanese rice bowl featuring tender chicken thighs glazed in a savory-sweet homemade teriyaki sauce, served over fluffy rice and garnished with fresh green onions. A satisfying dinner!

steps.instruction: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger to create the teriyaki marinade. Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces. Add chicken to the marinade, ensuring it's well coated. Marinate for at least 30 minutes at room temperature, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.

While chicken marinates, cook the short-grain rice according to package instructions. Typically, rinse rice thoroughly, then combine with 2 cups of water in a rice cooker or pot and cook until fluffy.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade (reserve the marinade). Cook chicken pieces until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes, flipping occasionally.

Pour the reserved marinade into the skillet with the cooked chicken. Bring to a simmer. In a small bowl, whisk cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to create a slurry. Stir the slurry into the simmering sauce and cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens to your desired consistency, about 2-3 minutes.
Divide cooked rice among 4 serving bowls. Top each with a generous portion of teriyaki chicken and sauce. Garnish with chopped green onions and toasted sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Ahi Poke Bowl
recipes.description: A fresh and vibrant Hawaiian-inspired poke bowl featuring marinated sushi-grade ahi tuna, served over sushi rice with crisp vegetables and a savory dressing. Quick and easy for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Cook the sushi rice according to package directions. Once cooked, fluff with a fork and let cool slightly.

In a medium bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar. Add the cubed ahi tuna, half of the sliced green onions, and half of the sesame seeds. Gently toss to coat and marinate for 15-20 minutes in the refrigerator.
While the tuna marinates, prepare the remaining ingredients: dice the cucumber, slice the avocados, and ensure edamame is cooked and shelled.
To assemble the poke bowls, divide the cooked sushi rice evenly among 4 serving bowls.
Arrange the marinated tuna over the rice in each bowl.
Artfully place the diced cucumber, sliced avocado, and shelled edamame around the tuna.
Garnish with the remaining green onions and sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic American Club Sandwich
recipes.description: A timeless American classic featuring layers of toasted bread, savory turkey, crispy bacon, fresh lettuce, and ripe tomato, all brought together with creamy mayonnaise. Perfect for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Cook bacon until crispy. Drain on paper towels and set aside. Slice tomatoes and wash lettuce leaves.
Toast the bread slices until golden brown. Spread mayonnaise evenly on one side of each toasted slice.
Assemble the first layer: On one slice of toast, layer half of the turkey, lettuce, tomato, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Top with a second slice of toast, mayonnaise-side down.

Assemble the second layer: On the second slice of toast, layer the crispy bacon, remaining turkey, more lettuce, tomato, and a slice of cheese (if using). Top with the third slice of toast, mayonnaise-side down.
Secure each sandwich with two toothpicks, then cut diagonally into quarters. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic American Gourmet Cheeseburger
recipes.description: A juicy, flavorful cheeseburger with perfectly seasoned patties, melted cheddar, crisp lettuce, and ripe tomatoes, all nestled in a toasted brioche bun. A quick and satisfying meal for any lunch.

steps.instruction: Divide ground beef into 4 equal portions and gently form into patties, slightly larger than the buns. Season generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a large skillet or grill over medium-high heat. Add butter to the skillet and toast the brioche buns until golden brown. Set aside.
Place patties on the hot skillet or grill. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer to desired doneness. During the last minute of cooking, place a cheese slice on each patty to melt.
Assemble the burgers: Place a cooked patty with melted cheese on the bottom half of each toasted bun. Top with lettuce, tomato, and red onion. Add condiments as desired and cover with the top bun.

recipes.title: Classic American Scrambled Eggs with Crispy Bacon and Toast
recipes.description: A quick and easy classic American breakfast featuring fluffy scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and golden toast. Perfect for a satisfying start to your day.

steps.instruction: Cook the bacon: Place bacon slices in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook until crispy, about 8-10 minutes, flipping occasionally. Remove bacon from the skillet and place on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess fat. Pour out most of the bacon grease from the skillet, leaving about 1 tablespoon.
Prepare the eggs: While the bacon is cooking, crack the eggs into a medium bowl. Add milk, salt, and black pepper. Whisk vigorously until the yolks and whites are fully combined and slightly frothy.

Scramble the eggs: Melt the butter in the same skillet (or a clean one) over medium-low heat. Pour in the egg mixture. Let the eggs sit undisturbed for about 30 seconds until the edges begin to set. Gently push the cooked egg from the edges towards the center with a spatula, allowing the uncooked egg to flow underneath. Continue cooking and gently stirring until the eggs are mostly set but still moist and creamy. Do not overcook.
Make the toast: While the eggs are scrambling, toast the bread slices to your desired crispness using a toaster or broiler.
Assemble and serve: Divide the scrambled eggs among four plates. Serve immediately with the crispy bacon and golden toast on the side. Optionally, garnish with fresh chives or parsley.

recipes.title: Classic Beef Stroganoff
recipes.description: A rich and creamy Russian dish featuring tender beef, mushrooms, and sour cream, perfect for a comforting dinner. This classic recipe is hearty and satisfying.

steps.instruction: Slice the beef sirloin into thin strips. Chop the onion and slice the mushrooms. Mince the garlic.
Heat butter in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Sear the beef in batches until browned, about 2-3 minutes per batch. Do not overcrowd the pan. Remove beef and set aside.

Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 3-5 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until tender and browned, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.

Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly to create a roux. Gradually whisk in the beef broth and Dijon mustard. Bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring until the sauce thickens.

Return the seared beef to the skillet. Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the sour cream, salt, and black pepper. Heat gently, stirring frequently, but do not allow the sauce to boil, as this can cause the sour cream to curdle.
Serve the Beef Stroganoff immediately over hot egg noodles or rice, garnished with fresh chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Classic British Full English Breakfast
recipes.description: A traditional and hearty British breakfast, perfect for a weekend treat or a substantial start to the day. This recipe brings together all the beloved components of a full English breakfast on one plate.

steps.instruction: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the sausages and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and keep warm.
In the same pan (or a separate one), add the bacon rashers. Cook for 3-5 minutes per side, or until crispy to your liking. Remove and keep warm with the sausages.
Add the remaining oil to the pan. Add the halved tomatoes and mushrooms. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until softened and slightly browned. Season with salt and pepper.
While the vegetables are cooking, heat the baked beans in a small saucepan or microwave until hot.
Fry the eggs: In a clean part of the pan or a separate pan, fry the eggs to your preference (sunny-side up, over easy, etc.). This usually takes 2-4 minutes.
Toast the bread and butter it generously.
Assemble each plate with 2 sausages, 2 bacon rashers, 1 fried egg, a portion of beans, cooked tomatoes, mushrooms, and a slice of buttered toast.

recipes.title: Classic Caprese Panini
recipes.description: A simple yet delicious Italian-inspired panini featuring fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze, grilled to golden perfection. Perfect for a quick and satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Slice the ciabatta bread horizontally. If using a whole loaf, cut into 4 equal portions first.
Slice the fresh mozzarella and tomatoes into even rounds.
Drizzle the inside of each bread half with olive oil. Layer mozzarella, tomato slices, and fresh basil leaves on the bottom half of each bread. Season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle balsamic glaze over the fillings and top with the other half of the bread.
Preheat a panini press or a grill pan over medium heat.
Place the assembled paninis in the press or pan. Grill for 3-4 minutes per side, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Remove from the press, let cool slightly, then cut in half and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Chicken Provençal
recipes.description: A rustic French classic featuring tender chicken braised with ripe tomatoes, fragrant garlic, Kalamata olives, and aromatic Herbes de Provence. A delightful and flavorful dinner.

steps.instruction: Pat chicken thighs dry with paper towels and season generously with salt and pepper.

Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Sear chicken thighs skin-side down for 5-7 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Flip and sear for another 3-4 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium. Add chopped onion to the pot and sauté for 5 minutes until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in diced tomatoes (undrained) and chicken broth. Stir in Herbes de Provence and fresh thyme. Bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
Return the seared chicken thighs to the pot, nestling them into the sauce. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and tender.
Stir in pitted Kalamata olives and cook for an additional 5 minutes, uncovered, to allow the sauce to thicken slightly.
Garnish with fresh chopped parsley before serving. Serve hot with crusty bread or rice.

recipes.title: Classic Chicken Shawarma Plate
recipes.description: Savor the flavors of the Middle East with this homemade chicken shawarma plate. Tender marinated chicken, creamy garlic sauce, fresh salad, and fluffy rice make for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Slice chicken thighs into thin strips. In a large bowl, combine chicken with 2 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, 2 cloves minced garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, cayenne (if using), salt, and black pepper. Mix well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight for best flavor.

Prepare the garlic yogurt sauce. In a small bowl, whisk together Greek yogurt, tahini, the remaining 2 cloves minced garlic, 2 tbsp water, and a pinch of salt. Adjust consistency with more water if needed. Refrigerate until serving.
Prepare the salad components. Dice the cucumber and tomatoes. Thinly slice the red onion. Chop fresh parsley. Set aside.

Cook the basmati rice according to package directions. Typically, combine 1 cup rice with 2 cups water and a pinch of salt in a pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed. Let stand for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.

Heat the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet or cast-iron pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken in a single layer, working in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding. Cook for 5-7 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through.

To assemble the shawarma plates, divide the cooked rice among 4 plates. Arrange cooked chicken alongside the rice. Add generous portions of the fresh cucumber, tomato, and red onion salad. Drizzle with the prepared garlic yogurt sauce. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately with warm pita bread.

recipes.title: Classic Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A quick and flavorful Chinese-inspired stir-fry featuring tender chicken, crisp broccoli, and a savory ginger-garlic sauce. Perfect for a weeknight dinner.

steps.instruction: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, chicken broth, minced ginger, minced garlic, cornstarch, and sesame oil. Set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken pieces and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside.

Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to the skillet. Add broccoli florets and sliced carrots. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add sliced red bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.

Return the cooked chicken to the skillet with the vegetables. Give the reserved sauce a quick whisk and pour it over the chicken and vegetables. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats everything, about 1-2 minutes.
Serve immediately over steamed rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Classic Chicken and Ginger Congee
recipes.description: A comforting and savory Chinese rice porridge, perfect for a hearty breakfast. Slow-cooked with tender chicken, aromatic ginger, and garnished with fresh green onions.

steps.instruction: Rinse the rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Dice the chicken breast into small, bite-sized pieces. Peel and julienne the fresh ginger. Chop the green onions for garnish.

In a large pot, combine the rinsed rice, chicken broth, and water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the rice breaks down and the congee thickens.

Add the diced chicken and julienned ginger to the pot. Continue to simmer for another 15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the congee reaches your desired consistency. Stir in soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and white pepper.
Ladle the hot congee into bowls. Garnish generously with chopped green onions before serving.

recipes.title: Classic Chicken and Sausage Jambalaya
recipes.description: A hearty and flavorful Cajun classic, this jambalaya combines chicken, smoked sausage, and the "holy trinity" of vegetables with seasoned rice. Perfect for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Season chicken pieces with 1 tablespoon of Cajun seasoning. Chop onion, celery, and bell pepper (the "holy trinity"). Mince garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add sliced sausage to the pot and cook until browned.
Add onion, celery, and bell pepper to the pot. Cook until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of Cajun seasoning, diced tomatoes (undrained), and chicken broth. Bring to a boil.
Add the uncooked rice, browned chicken, and sausage back to the pot. Stir well. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered.
Fluff with a fork. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired, and serve hot.

recipes.title: Classic Coq au Vin Rouge
recipes.description: A rich and savory French classic featuring chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms, bacon, and aromatic vegetables. Perfect for a special dinner, offering deep flavors and tender meat.

steps.instruction: Pat chicken pieces dry and season generously with salt and pepper. In a large Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot, cook the bacon lardons over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside, leaving rendered fat in the pot.
Add olive oil to the pot if needed. Sear the chicken pieces in batches until deeply golden brown on all sides. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add carrots, celery, and pearl onions to the pot and cook until softened, about 8-10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and cook, stirring constantly, for 2-3 minutes to create a roux.
Gradually pour in the red wine, scraping the bottom of the pot to deglaze. Bring to a simmer, then add chicken broth, thyme sprigs, and bay leaf. Return the seared chicken to the pot.
Cover the pot and transfer to a preheated oven at 160°C (325°F). Braise for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the chicken is very tender and easily pulls away from the bone.
While the chicken braises, melt butter in a separate pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until browned and tender, about 8-10 minutes. Set aside.

Once chicken is cooked, remove it from the pot. Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean saucepan, pressing on the solids to extract all liquid. Discard solids. Skim any excess fat from the sauce.
Return the sauce to a simmer and reduce until it reaches your desired consistency, about 10-15 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Return the chicken, cooked mushrooms, and reserved bacon lardons to the sauce. Heat gently until warmed through.
Garnish with fresh chopped parsley and serve hot, perhaps with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

ingredients.name: Bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs and drumsticks

recipes.title: Classic Cuban Sandwich
recipes.description: A savory pressed sandwich featuring roast pork, ham, Swiss cheese, dill pickles, and yellow mustard, all grilled to perfection on crusty Cuban bread. A hearty and flavorful lunch.

steps.instruction: Slice the Cuban bread lengthwise, but not all the way through, creating a hinge. Spread yellow mustard generously on the inside of both halves of each bread portion.
Layer the ingredients onto the bottom half of each bread portion in the following order: ham, roast pork, Swiss cheese, and dill pickles. Close the sandwiches.

Lightly butter the top and bottom of each assembled sandwich. Place the sandwiches on a preheated panini press or a heavy skillet over medium heat. If using a skillet, press down firmly with another heavy pan or a brick wrapped in foil.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and crispy, the cheese is melted, and the fillings are heated through. Flip once if using a skillet.
Remove from the press or skillet, slice each sandwich diagonally, and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Easy Tortilla Española
recipes.description: A simple and delicious Spanish potato and onion omelette, perfect for a hearty breakfast or brunch. This traditional dish is surprisingly easy to prepare and incredibly satisfying for the whole family.

steps.instruction: Peel and thinly slice the potatoes and onion. Aim for uniform thickness for even cooking.

Heat olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced potatoes and onion. Cook gently, stirring occasionally, until very tender but not browned, about 15-20 minutes. Drain excess oil, reserving about 1 tablespoon in the pan.
While potatoes cook, whisk the eggs in a large bowl with salt and pepper until well combined.
Add the cooked potatoes and onions to the whisked eggs, mixing well to ensure all ingredients are coated.

Return the reserved olive oil to the skillet over medium-low heat. Pour the egg and potato mixture into the skillet, spreading evenly. Cook for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are set and the bottom is golden brown.

Place a large plate over the skillet, then carefully invert the tortilla onto the plate. Slide it back into the skillet to cook the other side for another 5-7 minutes, until golden and cooked through.
Slide the tortilla onto a clean serving plate. Let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving warm or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Classic Filipino Chicken Adobo
recipes.description: A beloved Filipino dish, Classic Chicken Adobo features tender chicken pieces simmered in a rich, tangy, and savory sauce made with soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and bay leaves. Perfect for lunch or dinner.

steps.instruction: Mince the garlic. If using whole chicken, cut it into serving pieces.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and brown them lightly on all sides for about 5-7 minutes.
Pour in the soy sauce and vinegar. Add the bay leaves and whole black peppercorns. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
Add the water. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to low. Let it simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is tender, stirring occasionally.
Remove the cover, increase the heat to medium-high, and let the sauce reduce and thicken slightly for about 5-7 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt if needed.
Serve the Classic Filipino Chicken Adobo hot with steamed white rice.

recipes.title: Classic Fluffy Pancakes
recipes.description: Start your day right with these easy-to-make, fluffy pancakes. Perfect for a quick breakfast or a leisurely brunch, they're a crowd-pleaser for all ages.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and melted butter until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Stir gently with a whisk or fork until just combined. A few lumps are okay; do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or large non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the hot surface.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and bubbles appear on the surface of the pancake. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.

recipes.title: Classic Fluffy Pancakes
recipes.description: Start your day right with these incredibly light and fluffy classic pancakes. Perfect for a weekend breakfast or a special treat, they're easy to make and always a crowd-pleaser.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and melted butter until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. A few lumps are okay; do not overmix.
Heat a lightly greased griddle or large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the hot surface.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip only once.
Serve immediately with your favorite toppings like syrup, fruit, or whipped cream.

recipes.title: Classic Fluffy Scrambled Eggs with Sourdough Toast
recipes.description: A simple yet delicious American breakfast staple featuring perfectly fluffy scrambled eggs served alongside crispy sourdough toast. Quick to prepare and satisfying.

steps.instruction: In a medium bowl, whisk together the large eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper until well combined and slightly frothy. Do not over-whisk.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Add the butter and let it melt until foamy. Swirl to coat the bottom of the pan.
Pour the egg mixture into the heated skillet. Let it sit undisturbed for about 30-60 seconds until the edges begin to set.

Using a heat-resistant spatula, gently push the cooked egg from the edges towards the center of the pan, tilting the pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath. Continue this process, stirring and folding gently, until the eggs are mostly set but still moist and creamy. This should take 5-7 minutes.
While the eggs are cooking, toast the sourdough bread to your desired crispness.
Immediately transfer the scrambled eggs to plates and serve alongside the toasted bread. Garnish with fresh chives if using.

recipes.title: Classic French Crêpes with Berries & Cream
recipes.description: Light and delicate French crêpes, perfect for a delightful breakfast. Serve with fresh berries and a dollop of whipped cream for a touch of elegance.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, and salt until well combined.
In a separate medium bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, whisking continuously until the batter is smooth and lump-free. Let the batter rest at room temperature for 10 minutes.

Heat a lightly buttered 8-inch non-stick pan or crêpe maker over medium heat. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the center of the pan, immediately tilting and swirling the pan to spread the batter evenly into a thin circle.
Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the surface appears set. Carefully flip the crêpe with a spatula and cook for another 30-60 seconds on the other side.
Transfer the cooked crêpe to a plate. Repeat with the remaining batter, lightly buttering the pan between each crêpe if needed.
Serve the warm crêpes folded into quarters or rolled, topped with fresh mixed berries and a dollop of whipped cream.

recipes.title: Classic Full English Breakfast
recipes.description: A hearty and traditional British breakfast featuring sausages, bacon, eggs, baked beans, grilled tomatoes, sautéed mushrooms, black pudding, and toast.

steps.instruction: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F) if you plan to keep items warm. Prepare all ingredients: slice mushrooms, halve tomatoes, and set out sausages, bacon, eggs, and black pudding.

Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large frying pan or griddle over medium heat. Add the sausages and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through. In a separate pan or alongside the sausages, cook the black pudding slices for 2-3 minutes per side until crispy. Remove sausages and black pudding, and keep warm (e.g., in the preheated oven).
In the same pan, add the bacon rashers and cook for 3-5 minutes per side until crispy to your liking. Remove bacon and keep warm with the sausages and black pudding.

Add the remaining 1 tbsp of oil (or a knob of butter) to the pan. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes until softened and lightly browned. Add the halved tomatoes, cut-side down, and cook for 3-4 minutes until slightly charred and softened. Season with salt and pepper. Remove and keep warm.
While other items are cooking, gently heat the baked beans in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally, until hot.
Fry the eggs: In a clean pan, heat a little oil or butter over medium heat. Crack the eggs into the pan and cook to your preference (e.g., sunny-side up, over easy). Season with salt and pepper.
Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
Assemble each plate with 2 sausages, 2 rashers of bacon, 1 egg, a portion of baked beans, grilled tomato halves, sautéed mushrooms, a slice of black pudding (if using), and a slice of toast.

recipes.title: Classic Full English Breakfast
recipes.description: A hearty and traditional British breakfast featuring fried eggs, crispy bacon, savory sausages, baked beans, mushrooms, and grilled tomatoes. Perfect for a weekend treat.

steps.instruction: Prepare ingredients: slice mushrooms and halve tomatoes. Get all other ingredients ready.

Heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the pork sausages and cook for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and keep warm.
In the same pan, add the bacon slices. Cook for 5-8 minutes, turning once, until crispy. Remove and keep warm with the sausages.
Add the sliced mushrooms and halved tomatoes to the pan (add a little more oil if needed). Cook for 5-7 minutes until softened and slightly caramelized. Remove and keep warm.
While other items are cooking, heat the canned baked beans in a small saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally, until hot.

In a separate frying pan, heat the remaining 1 tbsp of vegetable oil over medium heat. Crack in the eggs and fry for 2-4 minutes, or until the whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your preference.
Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
Assemble each plate with 2 sausages, 2 slices of bacon, 1 fried egg, a portion of baked beans, cooked mushrooms, and a tomato half. Serve immediately with toast.

recipes.title: Classic Full English Breakfast
recipes.description: A hearty and traditional British breakfast featuring sausages, bacon, eggs, beans, tomatoes, mushrooms, and toast. Perfect for a weekend treat or a substantial start to the day.

steps.instruction: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F) if you prefer to keep items warm, or prepare a large frying pan and a separate saucepan.

Cook the sausages: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the sausages and cook for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through. Remove and keep warm.
Cook the bacon: In the same pan, add the bacon rashers and cook for 3-5 minutes per side, or until crispy to your liking. Remove and keep warm with the sausages.
Cook the mushrooms and tomatoes: Add the sliced mushrooms and halved tomatoes to the pan. Cook for 5-7 minutes until softened and slightly browned. Season with salt and pepper. Remove and keep warm.
Heat the baked beans: While other items are cooking, empty the can of baked beans into a small saucepan and heat gently over low heat, stirring occasionally, until hot.

Fry the eggs: Add the remaining tablespoon of oil (or a knob of butter) to the pan. Crack the eggs into the pan and fry for 2-3 minutes for runny yolks, or longer for firmer yolks. Season with salt and pepper.
Make the toast: Toast the slices of bread to your preferred crispness. Butter them if desired.
Assemble the plates: Divide the sausages, bacon, eggs, beans, mushrooms, tomatoes, and toast among four plates. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Hainanese Chicken Rice
recipes.description: A beloved Singaporean dish featuring tender poached chicken, fragrant rice cooked in chicken broth, and a trio of essential dipping sauces. A comforting and flavorful meal.

steps.instruction: Prepare the chicken: Clean the whole chicken thoroughly. Rub the skin and cavity with salt, then rinse well. Stuff the cavity with half of the sliced ginger, crushed garlic, and spring onion sections.

Poach the chicken: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the remaining ginger, garlic, and spring onions to the water. Carefully submerge the chicken. Reduce heat to a gentle simmer, cover, and cook for 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through (internal temperature 165°F/74°C).

Ice bath and rest: Immediately remove the cooked chicken from the pot and plunge it into a large bowl of ice water for 10 minutes. This stops the cooking process and helps achieve a smooth, gelatinous skin. Reserve the poaching liquid for the rice and soup. After the ice bath, remove the chicken and let it rest on a cutting board.

Cook the fragrant rice: In a rice cooker or heavy-bottomed pot, combine the washed jasmine rice with 4 cups of the reserved chicken poaching liquid (skim any excess fat from the top for extra flavor). Add a pinch of salt. Cook according to your rice cooker's instructions or until the rice is fluffy and the liquid is absorbed.

Assemble and serve: Once the chicken has rested, chop it into serving pieces. Drizzle the chicken with sesame oil and light soy sauce. Serve the chopped chicken over portions of fragrant rice, garnished with fresh cucumber slices and chopped coriander. Offer chili sauce, ginger-garlic paste, and extra light soy sauce on the side for dipping.

recipes.title: Classic Ham and Gruyere Quiche
recipes.description: A rich and savory French quiche featuring smoky ham, nutty Gruyere cheese, and a creamy egg custard baked in a flaky pastry crust. Perfect for a delightful lunch or brunch.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Prick the bottom of the pie crust with a fork. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until lightly golden. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, milk, salt, pepper, and nutmeg until well combined.
Sprinkle the diced ham and shredded Gruyere cheese evenly over the bottom of the pre-baked pie crust.
Carefully pour the egg mixture over the ham and cheese in the pie crust.
Bake for 35-45 minutes, or until the center is just set and a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. The top should be golden brown.
Let the quiche rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing and serving. This allows the custard to set completely.

recipes.title: Classic Indian Chicken Curry with Basmati Rice
recipes.description: A flavorful and aromatic Indian chicken curry, slow-cooked in a rich tomato-onion gravy with traditional spices, served alongside fluffy basmati rice. Perfect for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Wash and chop chicken into 1-inch pieces. Finely chop onion and tomatoes. Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until water runs clear.

Cook basmati rice: Combine 250g rice with 500ml water and 0.5 tsp salt in a pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 12-15 minutes until water is absorbed. Let stand for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or deep pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until softened and oil separates.
Stir in turmeric, cumin, coriander, and remaining salt. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until aromatic. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned on all sides.
Pour in 500ml water, bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and tender.
Stir in garam masala. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with the prepared basmati rice.

recipes.title: Classic Indonesian Nasi Goreng
recipes.description: A classic Indonesian fried rice, packed with savory flavors, aromatic spices, and a mix of vegetables and protein. Topped with a fried egg, it's a quick and satisfying meal perfect for lunch or dinner.

steps.instruction: Prepare all ingredients: slice shallots and chilies, mince garlic, dice chicken, and measure out sauces. Ensure rice is cold and separated.
Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the shallots, garlic, chilies, and toasted shrimp paste. Stir-fry until fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the diced chicken to the wok and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until slightly tender-crisp.

Add the day-old rice to the wok. Pour in the sweet soy sauce, regular soy sauce, salt, and white pepper. Stir-fry vigorously, breaking up any clumps of rice, until all ingredients are well combined and the rice is heated through and slightly caramelized, about 5-8 minutes.
While the rice is cooking, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a separate pan. Fry the eggs sunny-side up until the whites are set and the yolks are still runny.
Divide the nasi goreng among serving plates. Top each portion with a fried egg, sliced spring onions, and a sprinkle of fried shallots. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Korean Bibimbap
recipes.description: A vibrant and healthy Korean mixed rice dish, topped with seasoned vegetables, savory beef (or tofu), and a fried egg. A customizable and delicious meal perfect for lunch or dinner.

steps.instruction: Prepare the vegetables: Wash spinach and bean sprouts. Julienne carrots and zucchini. Slice mushrooms. Mince garlic.

Cook each vegetable separately: Blanch spinach and bean sprouts briefly in boiling water, then drain and season lightly with sesame oil and a pinch of salt. Sauté julienned carrots, zucchini, and sliced mushrooms in a pan with a little oil until tender-crisp, seasoning each lightly.

Marinate and cook the beef: In a bowl, combine sliced beef with 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1 teaspoon sugar. Marinate for 10-15 minutes. Cook the beef in a hot pan until browned and cooked through.
Fry the eggs: Heat a little oil in a pan and fry each egg sunny-side up, ensuring the yolk remains runny.

Assemble the Bibimbap: Divide the cooked rice among four serving bowls. Artfully arrange the cooked vegetables, beef (or tofu), and a fried egg on top of the rice. Place a dollop of gochujang in the center or on the side.
Serve immediately, drizzling with extra sesame oil and sprinkling with toasted sesame seeds. Encourage diners to mix all ingredients thoroughly before eating.

recipes.title: Classic Lomo Saltado
recipes.description: A vibrant Peruvian stir-fry featuring tender beef, red onions, tomatoes, and crispy French fries, all coated in a savory soy-vinegar sauce. Served with fluffy white rice.

steps.instruction: Prepare all ingredients: Slice beef into 1-inch strips, cut red onion and Roma tomatoes into thick wedges, mince garlic, chop cilantro, and cut potatoes into French fries.
In a bowl, marinate the beef strips with minced garlic, cumin, salt, and black pepper. Let it sit for at least 5 minutes while you prepare the potatoes.

Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep pot over medium-high heat. Fry the potato strips in batches until golden brown and crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Season with salt.

Drain most of the oil from the skillet, leaving about 2 tablespoons. Increase heat to high. Add the marinated beef and stir-fry quickly until browned on all sides, about 2-3 minutes. Remove beef from the pan and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the red onion wedges and stir-fry for 2 minutes until slightly softened. Add the tomato wedges and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Deglaze the pan with red wine vinegar, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom. Add soy sauce and aji amarillo paste, stirring to combine. Bring the sauce to a quick simmer.
Return the cooked beef and fried potatoes to the skillet. Toss everything together to coat evenly with the sauce. Stir in the fresh chopped cilantro.
Serve immediately with fluffy white rice on the side.

recipes.title: Classic Osso Buco with Gremolata
recipes.description: A rich, slow-braised veal shank dish, simmered in wine and vegetables until fork-tender, then topped with a vibrant gremolata. A challenging but rewarding Italian classic perfect for a special dinner.

steps.instruction: Pat the veal shanks dry with paper towels. Season generously with salt and black pepper, then dredge each shank in flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Sear the veal shanks on all sides until deeply browned, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the shanks and set aside.
Add the chopped onion, carrots, and celery to the same pot. Sauté over medium heat until softened, about 8-10 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.

Pour in the dry white wine, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Bring to a simmer and cook until the wine has reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, chicken broth, bay leaf, and thyme.

Return the seared veal shanks to the pot, nestling them into the liquid. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, then cover the pot and transfer it to a preheated oven at 325°F (160°C). Braise for 2.5 to 3 hours, or until the veal is fork-tender and easily pulls away from the bone.
While the osso buco is braising, prepare the gremolata: In a small bowl, combine the orange zest, lemon zest, and chopped fresh parsley.

Once cooked, carefully remove the veal shanks from the pot. Skim any excess fat from the sauce. Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve the osso buco hot, spooning the rich sauce over the veal and garnishing generously with the fresh gremolata.

recipes.title: Classic Pork Schnitzel with Lemon
recipes.description: Crispy pan-fried pork cutlets, traditionally pounded thin and breaded, served with a fresh lemon wedge. A beloved German classic perfect for a hearty dinner.

steps.instruction: Place pork cutlets between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound them to about 1/4-inch thickness using a meat mallet or heavy pan.
Season both sides of the pounded pork cutlets generously with salt and pepper.
Set up a breading station: one shallow dish with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs.
Dredge each pork cutlet in flour, shaking off excess. Dip into beaten egg, letting excess drip off. Finally, coat thoroughly with breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Fry schnitzels in batches for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.
Transfer fried schnitzels to a wire rack lined with paper towels to drain excess oil. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Classic Shakshuka
recipes.description: A vibrant and savory Israeli breakfast dish featuring eggs gently poached in a rich, spiced tomato and bell pepper sauce. Perfect for a hearty start to your day.

steps.instruction: Heat olive oil in a large, deep skillet or cast-iron pan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and bell pepper, and cook until softened, about 8-10 minutes.
Add minced garlic, cumin, paprika, and chili flakes (if using) to the skillet. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant, stirring constantly.

Stir in the crushed tomatoes and tomato paste. Season with salt and pepper. Bring the sauce to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld and the sauce to thicken slightly.

Create 6 small indentations in the tomato sauce using the back of a spoon. Carefully crack one egg into each indentation. Cover the skillet and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still runny (or cooked to your preference).
Remove from heat. Garnish generously with fresh chopped parsley or cilantro. Serve immediately, directly from the skillet, with crusty bread for dipping.

recipes.title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: An authentic Roman pasta dish featuring al dente spaghetti, crispy guanciale, creamy egg and Pecorino Romano sauce, and freshly ground black pepper. A rich and satisfying dinner.

steps.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add the spaghetti and cook according to package directions until al dente.

While pasta cooks, dice the guanciale into small cubes. In a large skillet, cook the guanciale over medium heat until crispy and its fat has rendered. Remove guanciale with a slotted spoon, leaving rendered fat in the pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the whole eggs, egg yolks, grated Pecorino Romano, and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper until smooth and creamy.
Before draining the pasta, reserve about 1 cup of the starchy pasta water. Drain the spaghetti and immediately add it to the skillet with the rendered guanciale fat. Toss to coat.

Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti, tossing continuously with tongs to emulsify the sauce. Add a splash of reserved pasta water as needed to achieve a creamy consistency. Stir in the crispy guanciale.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Pecorino Romano and black pepper.

recipes.title: Classic Spanish Tortilla (Tortilla Española)
recipes.description: A simple yet satisfying Spanish omelette made with thinly sliced potatoes and onions, cooked slowly until tender, then bound with eggs and pan-fried to golden perfection. Perfect for breakfast or brunch.

steps.instruction: Peel and thinly slice the potatoes and onion. Aim for uniform thickness for even cooking.

Heat the olive oil in a large, non-stick skillet (about 9-10 inches) over medium-low heat. Add the sliced potatoes and onions. Season with salt and pepper. Cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are very tender and translucent, but not browned. This will take about 15-20 minutes.
While the potatoes and onions are cooking, whisk the large eggs in a separate large bowl until well combined.

Once the potatoes and onions are tender, carefully drain most of the olive oil from the skillet, leaving only about 1-2 tablespoons. Transfer the cooked potatoes and onions to the bowl with the whisked eggs. Stir gently to ensure all the potatoes are coated. Let the mixture rest for 5 minutes.

Pour the egg and potato mixture back into the same skillet (with the remaining oil) over medium heat. Spread the mixture evenly. Cook for 5-7 minutes, gently shaping the sides with a spatula, until the bottom is golden brown and the edges are set.

Place a large plate (larger than the skillet) over the skillet and carefully invert the tortilla onto the plate. Slide the tortilla back into the skillet, uncooked side down. Cook for another 3-5 minutes, or until cooked through and golden brown on the other side.
Slide the finished tortilla onto a clean plate. Let it rest for a few minutes before slicing into wedges and serving warm or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Classic Swedish Meatballs
recipes.description: Tender, savory meatballs served in a rich and creamy gravy, perfect for a comforting lunch. A classic Swedish dish that's surprisingly easy to make at home.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, mix ground beef, ground pork, finely chopped onion, breadcrumbs, milk, egg, allspice, salt, and black pepper until just combined. Do not overmix.
Roll the mixture into small, 1-inch meatballs. You should get about 30-35 meatballs.
Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the meatballs in batches on all sides, then remove them from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, to create a roux.

Gradually whisk in the beef broth until smooth. Bring to a simmer, then stir in the heavy cream, Dijon mustard, and Worcestershire sauce. Return the meatballs to the skillet, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

recipes.title: Classic Vietnamese Pork Banh Mi
recipes.description: A delicious and authentic Vietnamese sandwich featuring marinated pork, crispy baguette, creamy pate, pickled vegetables, fresh herbs, and spicy jalapeños. A perfect lunch!

steps.instruction: Prepare pickled vegetables: In a bowl, combine julienned carrots and daikon radish. In a separate small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, water, and 1 tablespoon of sugar. Pour over vegetables and let sit for at least 15 minutes.
Marinate pork: In a bowl, combine thinly sliced pork with fish sauce, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and minced garlic. Let marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Cook pork: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated pork and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Prepare baguettes: Slice baguettes lengthwise, but not all the way through. Lightly toast if desired. Spread pate on one side and mayonnaise on the other.
Assemble sandwiches: Fill each baguette with cooked pork, drained pickled vegetables, fresh cilantro, sliced jalapeño, and cucumber slices. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Creamy Tomato and Sausage Penne
recipes.description: A quick and satisfying Italian dinner featuring savory Italian sausage, rich tomato sauce, and a touch of cream, all tossed with al dente penne pasta. Perfect for a flavorful weeknight meal.

steps.instruction: Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and remove sausage from casings. Measure out heavy cream, crushed tomatoes, and grate Parmesan cheese. Chop fresh basil.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add penne pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente (approx. 8-10 minutes). Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.

While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add Italian sausage and cook, breaking it apart with a spoon, until browned and cooked through (approx. 5 minutes). Drain any excess fat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet with the cooked sausage. Sauté for 4 minutes until the onion softens and garlic is fragrant.
Stir in the crushed tomatoes. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

Reduce heat to low. Stir in the heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese until the sauce is creamy and heated through. Add the cooked and drained pasta to the skillet. Toss to coat evenly. If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of the reserved pasta water.
Stir in the fresh chopped basil. Season with salt and black pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.

ingredients.name: Italian sausage (mild or hot, casings removed)

recipes.title: Easy Caribbean Jerk Chicken Wraps
recipes.description: Flavorful jerk chicken, crisp veggies, and a zesty sauce wrapped in a tortilla. A quick and delicious Caribbean-inspired lunch that's simple to make and packed with vibrant taste.

steps.instruction: Slice chicken breasts into thin strips. In a bowl, toss chicken with jerk seasoning and olive oil until evenly coated.
Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken strips and cook for 5-7 minutes, flipping occasionally, until cooked through and lightly charred.
While chicken cooks, prepare the lime mayo by mixing mayonnaise and lime juice in a small bowl. Warm tortillas according to package instructions.
To assemble, spread a thin layer of lime mayo on each warm tortilla. Layer with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, sliced red onion, and cooked jerk chicken. Roll up tightly and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Easy Chicken & Cheese Quesadillas
recipes.description: Quick and delicious cheesy chicken quesadillas, perfect for a satisfying lunch. Made with seasoned chicken, melted cheese, and warm tortillas, ready in under 30 minutes.

steps.instruction: Dice the chicken breast into small pieces and toss with taco seasoning until evenly coated.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside.

Wipe the skillet clean. Reduce heat to medium. Place one tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle half of the tortilla with a quarter cup of shredded cheese, then add a portion of the cooked chicken, and top with another quarter cup of cheese. Place a second tortilla on top.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Carefully flip the quesadilla to cook the other side.
Remove the cooked quesadilla from the skillet and place on a cutting board. Repeat with the remaining tortillas, chicken, and cheese to make a total of four quesadillas.
Slice each quesadilla into wedges and serve immediately with salsa and sour cream.

recipes.title: Easy Falafel Wraps with Tahini Sauce
recipes.description: Quick and easy homemade falafel wraps, packed with fresh herbs, crispy falafel, crisp vegetables, and a creamy tahini sauce, perfect for a satisfying Middle Eastern lunch.

steps.instruction: Combine drained chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped but not pureed. Do not overmix.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the flour. Form into 12-16 small patties or balls.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the falafel patties for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy.

While falafel cooks, prepare the tahini sauce: whisk together tahini, lemon juice, and cold water in a small bowl until smooth and creamy. Add more water if needed to reach desired consistency. Season with a pinch of salt.
Warm the pita bread according to package instructions (e.g., microwave for 15-20 seconds or toast lightly).
Assemble the wraps: spread tahini sauce inside each pita, then fill with falafel, shredded lettuce, diced tomato, and cucumber. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Easy Foul Medames
recipes.description: A quick and authentic Middle Eastern breakfast featuring stewed fava beans, seasoned with lemon, garlic, and olive oil. Perfect for a hearty, nutritious start to your day.

steps.instruction: Drain and rinse the canned fava beans thoroughly. Mince the garlic and juice the lemon.
In a medium saucepan, combine the drained fava beans, minced garlic, cumin, and 0.25 cup of water. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.

Mash the fava beans lightly with a fork or potato masher, leaving some whole for texture. Continue to simmer for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through and slightly thickened. Add a splash more water if it becomes too dry.
Remove from heat. Stir in the lemon juice and 3 tablespoons of olive oil. Season with salt to taste.
Transfer the foul medames to a serving dish. Drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley and diced tomato. Serve warm with fresh pita bread.

recipes.title: Easy Greek Mezze Platter
recipes.description: A vibrant and fresh Greek mezze platter, perfect for a light lunch or appetizer. Featuring creamy hummus, salty feta, crisp vegetables, and warm pita bread for a delightful Mediterranean experience.

steps.instruction: Arrange the hummus in a small bowl and place it in the center of a large serving platter.
Around the hummus, artfully arrange the crumbled feta cheese, Kalamata olives, sliced cucumber, and halved cherry tomatoes.
Warm the pita bread in a toaster or oven, then cut into wedges. Place the pita wedges around the edge of the platter.
Drizzle the entire platter with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Easy Irish Colcannon with Sausages
recipes.description: A simple and hearty Irish dinner featuring creamy Colcannon (mashed potatoes with cabbage or kale) served alongside pan-fried Irish pork sausages and sautéed onions. Perfect for a quick and comforting weeknight meal.

steps.instruction: Peel and chop the potatoes into 1-inch pieces. Shred the cabbage (or kale). Chop the onion.
Place chopped potatoes in a large pot, cover with cold salted water, and bring to a boil. Cook for 15-20 minutes until very tender. Drain thoroughly.

While potatoes are cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sausages and cook, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through (about 10-12 minutes). Remove sausages from skillet and set aside. Add the chopped onion to the same skillet and sauté until softened and lightly caramelized (about 5-7 minutes).
In a separate pot or steamer, steam or blanch the shredded cabbage (or kale) for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp. Drain well.
Return the drained hot potatoes to the pot. Add milk, butter, salt, and pepper. Mash until smooth and creamy. Stir in the cooked cabbage (or kale) until well combined.
Serve the Colcannon immediately, topped with the pan-fried sausages and sautéed onions.

recipes.title: Easy Irish Shepherd's Pie
recipes.description: A comforting and hearty Irish classic, this easy shepherd's pie features a savory ground lamb and vegetable filling topped with creamy mashed potatoes, perfect for a cozy dinner.

steps.instruction: Peel and quarter potatoes. Place in a large pot, cover with cold water, add a pinch of salt, and bring to a boil. Cook until fork-tender.

Drain potatoes and set aside. While potatoes cook, heat a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add ground lamb and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned. Drain excess fat.

Add chopped onion and carrots to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and beef broth. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly. Stir in frozen peas. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Mash the cooked potatoes with milk and butter until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Spread the lamb mixture evenly in the bottom of the skillet (or transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish). Top with the mashed potatoes, spreading evenly or creating decorative peaks with a fork.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the filling is bubbling. If desired, broil for the last 2-3 minutes for extra browning.
Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley.

recipes.title: Easy Italian Herb Frittata
recipes.description: A simple and delicious Italian-style frittata packed with fresh herbs, spinach, and Parmesan cheese. Perfect for a quick and satisfying breakfast or brunch.

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease an 8-inch oven-safe skillet or pie dish.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, grated Parmesan cheese, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
Heat olive oil in the oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and bell pepper; sauté for 3-5 minutes until softened. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Pour the egg mixture over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet. Gently stir to distribute the vegetables evenly.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 18-22 minutes, or until the frittata is set and lightly golden brown on top.
Let the frittata rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.title: Easy Korean Kimbap Rolls
recipes.description: Delicious and easy-to-make Korean kimbap rolls, perfect for a quick lunch or picnic. Filled with seasoned rice, fresh vegetables, and egg, offering a balanced and flavorful meal.

steps.instruction: Cook short-grain rice according to package directions. While still warm, transfer to a large bowl and mix with 1 tablespoon of sesame oil and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Let cool slightly.

Prepare fillings: Blanch spinach, squeeze out excess water, and season with a pinch of salt and sesame oil. Julienne carrot and lightly sauté for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender. Beat eggs, cook into a thin omelet, and slice into strips. Julienne cucumber and pickled radish.

Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat. Spread a thin, even layer of seasoned rice over 2/3 of the nori, leaving the top edge clear. Arrange strips of spinach, carrot, egg, cucumber, and pickled radish across the center of the rice.
Starting from the bottom, tightly roll the kimbap using the bamboo mat. Once rolled, brush the outside with a thin layer of sesame oil. Repeat for all remaining nori sheets and fillings.
Slice each kimbap roll into 1-inch thick pieces using a sharp, wet knife. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Easy Steamed Pork & Cabbage Buns
recipes.description: Quick and delicious steamed buns filled with savory ground pork and crisp napa cabbage. Perfect for a light lunch or appetizer, these easy-to-make buns bring authentic Chinese flavors to your table.

steps.instruction: Finely chop the napa cabbage, grate the fresh ginger, mince the garlic, and slice the green onions (reserving half for garnish).

In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, chopped napa cabbage, grated ginger, minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and half of the sliced green onions. In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water to create a slurry, then add it to the pork mixture.
Mix all ingredients thoroughly until well combined. Take each pre-made steamed bun and gently open it, then fill with approximately 2-3 tablespoons of the pork mixture.

Arrange the filled buns in a steamer basket, ensuring they are not overcrowded. Steam over boiling water for 12-15 minutes, or until the pork filling is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C).
Carefully remove the steamed buns from the steamer. Garnish with the remaining sliced green onions and serve hot.

recipes.title: Fiery Caribbean Curry Pork
recipes.description: A vibrant and aromatic Caribbean curry featuring tender pork simmered in a rich, spicy coconut milk sauce with potatoes and bell peppers. Perfect for a hearty dinner.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, combine pork cubes with 2 tbsp curry powder, minced garlic, grated ginger, chopped scotch bonnet pepper, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper. Mix well and let marinate for at least 30 minutes, or preferably 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the marinated pork in batches and brown on all sides. Remove browned pork and set aside.
Add chopped onion and bell pepper to the pot, sautéing until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1 tbsp curry powder and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.

Return the browned pork to the pot. Add cubed potatoes, coconut milk, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45-60 minutes, or until pork is tender and potatoes are cooked through. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve hot with rice or roti.

recipes.title: Fluffy American Pancakes
recipes.description: Easy-to-make, light, and fluffy pancakes perfect for a classic American breakfast. Serve with your favorite toppings like syrup, fresh fruit, or whipped cream for a delightful start to your day.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
In a separate medium bowl, whisk together the milk, large egg, melted unsalted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Mix gently with a whisk or spatula until just combined. A few lumps are perfectly fine; do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or large non-stick pan over medium heat. Test the heat by sprinkling a few drops of water; they should sizzle and evaporate quickly.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the hot griddle. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and bubbles form on the surface of the pancake before flipping.
Serve the fluffy pancakes immediately with your favorite toppings such as maple syrup, fresh berries, or whipped cream.

recipes.title: Fluffy Croissant French Toast
recipes.description: A delightful and easy French-inspired breakfast, transforming day-old croissants into a rich and fluffy French toast. Perfect for a weekend brunch or a special breakfast treat.

steps.instruction: Slice each day-old croissant in half lengthwise, creating two flat pieces. Set aside.
In a shallow dish or pie plate, whisk together the large eggs, whole milk, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon until well combined and frothy.
Gently dip each croissant half into the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are fully coated but not overly saturated. Allow to soak for about 30 seconds per side.
Melt 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter in a large non-stick skillet or on a griddle over medium heat. Ensure the butter coats the entire cooking surface.
Place two soaked croissant halves in the hot skillet. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Repeat with remaining butter and croissant halves.
Serve the Croissant French Toast immediately, drizzled generously with maple syrup. Optionally, garnish with fresh berries or a dusting of powdered sugar.

recipes.title: French Toast Croissant Bake
recipes.description: A delightful and easy French toast casserole featuring buttery croissants soaked in a sweet, custardy mixture, baked until golden and fluffy. Perfect for a special breakfast or brunch.

steps.instruction: Tear or slice croissants into large pieces. Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking dish with butter and arrange the croissant pieces evenly in it.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon until well combined.
Pour the egg mixture evenly over the croissants in the baking dish, ensuring all pieces are well-coated. Gently press down to help them absorb the liquid.
Let the croissants soak for at least 10-15 minutes at room temperature, or cover and refrigerate for up to 30 minutes for deeper absorption.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and the center is set.
Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes. Dust generously with powdered sugar before serving warm.

recipes.title: German Pretzel Sandwich with Ham and Cheese
recipes.description: A quick and easy German-inspired sandwich featuring soft pretzels, savory ham, creamy cheese, and a hint of mustard. Perfect for a satisfying lunch!

steps.instruction: Slice each soft pretzel horizontally, almost all the way through, to create a pocket for fillings.
Spread softened butter evenly on the inside of both halves of each pretzel.
On one half of each pretzel, spread a layer of Dijon mustard.
Layer ham slices and Swiss cheese slices inside each pretzel.
Add a lettuce leaf to each sandwich for freshness. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Greek Yogurt with Honey and Walnuts
recipes.description: A simple, healthy, and delicious Greek breakfast featuring creamy Greek yogurt, sweet honey, crunchy walnuts, and fresh berries. Quick to prepare and perfect for a nutritious morning boost.

steps.instruction: Divide the Greek yogurt evenly into 4 serving bowls.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of honey over the yogurt in each bowl.
Sprinkle chopped walnuts and fresh berries over the yogurt in each bowl.
Optionally, top each bowl with a sprinkle of granola for extra crunch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this refreshing Greek breakfast.

recipes.title: Hearty Polish Hunter's Stew (Bigos)
recipes.description: A traditional, slow-cooked Polish hunter's stew featuring sauerkraut, fresh cabbage, various meats, and mushrooms. Rich, savory, and perfect for a cold evening.

steps.instruction: Rehydrate dried mushrooms in warm water for 20 minutes. Drain, reserving liquid, and chop. Drain sauerkraut and rinse if too sour. Shred fresh cabbage. Cube pork, slice kielbasa, dice bacon, chop onion, and prunes.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the diced bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon and set aside, leaving rendered fat in the pot.
Add pork cubes to the pot and brown on all sides. Remove pork and set aside. Add sliced kielbasa and brown lightly. Remove and set aside.
Add chopped onion to the pot and sauté until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.

Return all meats (bacon, pork, kielbasa) to the pot. Add sauerkraut, fresh cabbage, rehydrated mushrooms, prunes, bay leaves, allspice, and black pepper. Pour in beef broth and red wine (if using), and a splash of the reserved mushroom liquid.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for at least 2-3 hours, or until the cabbage is very tender and flavors have melded. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Let the bigos rest for at least 30 minutes before serving. Bigos often tastes even better the next day.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

recipes.title: Italian Orzo Pasta Salad
recipes.description: A vibrant and refreshing Italian orzo pasta salad packed with fresh vegetables, herbs, and a tangy lemon-herb vinaigrette. Perfect for a light lunch or side dish.

steps.instruction: Cook orzo pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking and prevent sticking.
