While pasta cooks, prepare the vegetables: halve cherry tomatoes, dice cucumber, thinly slice red onion, and chop fresh basil.
In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper to create the dressing.
Add the cooled orzo, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, crumbled feta, and chopped basil to the bowl with the dressing.
Toss gently to combine all ingredients, ensuring the pasta and vegetables are evenly coated with the dressing.
Serve immediately or chill for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator for flavors to meld and for a more refreshing salad.

recipes.title: Kimchi Jeon (Savory Kimchi Pancake)
recipes.description: A classic Korean savory pancake featuring fermented kimchi, green onions, and a crispy exterior. Perfect for a hearty and flavorful breakfast or a quick snack.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, combine chopped kimchi, all-purpose flour, cold water, and egg. Mix until just combined. Do not overmix; a few lumps are fine.
Stir in the chopped green onions into the batter.
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a non-stick pan or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Pour about 1/4 of the batter into the pan, spreading it evenly to form a thin pancake.
Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy. Add more oil as needed for subsequent pancakes.
Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil as needed.
While pancakes are cooking, prepare a simple dipping sauce by mixing soy sauce and sesame oil in a small bowl.
Serve the kimchi pancakes hot, cut into wedges, with the dipping sauce on the side.

recipes.title: Lebanese Kafta Skewers
recipes.description: Flavorful Lebanese kafta, made with seasoned ground beef and fresh herbs, grilled to perfection. A classic Middle Eastern dish, easy to prepare and perfect for a family dinner.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, finely minced onion, chopped fresh parsley, salt, black pepper, allspice, and cinnamon. Mix thoroughly with your hands until all ingredients are well incorporated and the mixture is cohesive.
Divide the meat mixture into 8 equal portions. Form each portion around a skewer, pressing firmly to create an oblong shape, or shape into thick oblong patties if not using skewers.

Preheat a grill to medium-high heat or a large skillet over medium-high heat with olive oil. Grill or pan-fry the kafta skewers/patties for 4-6 minutes per side, turning occasionally, until cooked through and nicely browned with a slight char.
While kafta is cooking, slice the tomatoes and chop the fresh mint for serving.
Serve the hot kafta immediately with fresh sliced tomatoes, chopped mint, and warm pita bread. A side of hummus or tahini sauce also pairs well.

recipes.title: Lebanese Mezze Platter
recipes.description: A vibrant and flavorful Lebanese mezze platter featuring creamy hummus, smoky baba ghanoush, fresh vegetables, olives, and warm pita bread. Perfect for a light lunch or appetizer.

steps.instruction: Prepare Hummus: In a food processor, combine drained chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and 2 tablespoons of water. Blend until smooth, adding more water if needed for desired consistency. Season with salt to taste.
Prepare Baba Ghanoush: Roast or grill eggplant until very soft. Scoop out the flesh, mash it, and mix with 1 tablespoon olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt to taste.
Assemble Vegetables: Slice cucumber and tomatoes. Arrange on a platter with Kalamata olives.
Warm Pita: Lightly toast or warm pita bread in a pan or oven until soft and pliable.

Platter Assembly: Arrange hummus, baba ghanoush, fresh vegetables, olives, and warm pita bread on a large serving platter. Drizzle hummus and baba ghanoush with remaining olive oil and garnish with fresh chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Malaysian Beef Rendang
recipes.description: A rich, aromatic, and spicy Malaysian beef curry, slow-cooked until tender and dry with a complex blend of spices and coconut milk. Perfect for a hearty dinner.

steps.instruction: Prepare the spice paste: Blend shallots, garlic, ginger, galangal, lemongrass, fresh red chilies, soaked dried chilies, candlenuts, and turmeric powder with a little cooking oil until a smooth paste forms.

Heat the remaining cooking oil in a large pot or wok over medium heat. Sauté the blended spice paste until fragrant and the oil separates, about 10-15 minutes. Add the cinnamon stick, star anise, cardamom pods, and cloves. Stir for another 2 minutes.
Add the beef cubes to the pot and stir until well coated with the spice paste and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Pour in the thin coconut milk and tamarind paste. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until the beef is partially tender.

Add the thick coconut milk, kaffir lime leaves, and sliced turmeric leaves (if using). Continue to simmer uncovered over low heat, stirring frequently, until the sauce thickens, almost dries out, and the beef is very tender. This can take another 60-90 minutes.
Stir in the kerisik (toasted coconut), salt, and sugar. Cook for another 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld and the rendang to reach a dry consistency.
Remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes before serving with steamed rice or roti.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad Wraps
recipes.description: A quick and easy Middle Eastern-inspired lunch featuring mashed chickpeas mixed with fresh vegetables and a zesty tahini dressing, all wrapped in soft tortillas. Perfect for a light, healthy, and flavorful meal on the go.

steps.instruction: Drain and rinse the canned chickpeas thoroughly. Transfer them to a medium bowl and mash with a fork or potato masher until mostly smooth but still with some texture.
Finely dice the cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion. Chop the fresh parsley. Add all chopped vegetables and herbs to the bowl with the mashed chickpeas.
In a small separate bowl, whisk together the tahini, fresh lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper until well combined and creamy.
Pour the tahini dressing over the chickpea and vegetable mixture. Stir gently until all ingredients are evenly coated.

Lay out the whole wheat tortillas. Divide the chickpea salad evenly among the tortillas, placing it in the center. Fold in the sides and then roll up tightly to form wraps. Serve immediately or chill for later.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Lemon Herb Chicken with Roasted Vegetables
recipes.description: A simple and flavorful Mediterranean-inspired dish featuring tender chicken breast marinated in lemon and herbs, roasted alongside colorful vegetables like bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes. Perfect for a quick and healthy weeknight dinner.

steps.instruction: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, dried oregano, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.
Add the chicken breasts, chopped bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes to the bowl with the marinade. Toss everything together until the chicken and vegetables are evenly coated.
Spread the marinated chicken and vegetables in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Avoid overcrowding to ensure everything roasts instead of steams.
Roast for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through (internal temperature reaches 165°F / 74°C) and the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve immediately, perhaps with a side of quinoa or couscous if desired.

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken Burrito Bowl
recipes.description: A flavorful and healthy Mexican-inspired chicken burrito bowl, packed with fresh ingredients like seasoned chicken, fluffy rice, black beans, corn, and creamy avocado. Perfect for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Cook the rice according to package directions. Once cooked, fluff with a fork and set aside.
Cut chicken breasts into 1-inch cubes. In a medium bowl, toss chicken with 1 tbsp olive oil, chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until evenly coated.
Heat the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add seasoned chicken and cook for 6-8 minutes, or until cooked through and lightly browned. Remove from heat.
In a separate bowl, combine the rinsed black beans, corn, diced red onion, chopped cilantro, and lime juice. Stir gently to combine.
To assemble the bowls, divide the cooked rice among 4 serving bowls. Top each with a portion of the cooked chicken, the bean and corn mixture, and diced avocado.

recipes.title: Moroccan Couscous Salad
recipes.description: A vibrant and refreshing Moroccan-inspired couscous salad packed with fresh vegetables, chickpeas, and aromatic herbs, all tossed in a zesty lemon-cumin dressing. Perfect for a light lunch.

steps.instruction: Bring vegetable broth to a boil in a small saucepan. Add couscous, stir, cover, and remove from heat. Let it sit for 5 minutes until the liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork.
While couscous is resting, prepare the vegetables and herbs: dice the cucumber, halve the cherry tomatoes, finely dice the red onion, and chop the fresh mint and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, ground cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper to create the dressing.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the fluffed couscous, drained and rinsed chickpeas, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, diced red onion, chopped mint, and chopped parsley.
Pour the dressing over the couscous mixture and toss gently until all ingredients are well combined and coated.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes for flavors to meld.

recipes.title: Patatas Bravas
recipes.description: Crispy fried potatoes served with a spicy, smoky tomato sauce. A classic Spanish tapas dish, perfect for sharing at lunch or as an appetizer.

steps.instruction: Peel and cut potatoes into 2-3 cm cubes. Rinse them under cold water to remove excess starch, then pat them completely dry with a kitchen towel.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or deep pot over medium-high heat. Add the dried potato cubes and fry, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, about 20-25 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Season with salt.

While potatoes are frying, prepare the bravas sauce. In a small saucepan, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in tomato passata, smoked paprika, and chili flakes. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld. Season with salt to taste.
Arrange the crispy potatoes on a serving platter. Spoon the warm bravas sauce generously over the potatoes. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley, if desired. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Portuguese Bifana Sandwich
recipes.description: A classic Portuguese pork sandwich, marinated in white wine and garlic, pan-fried, and served on a crusty roll. A flavorful and satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Slice pork thinly (if not already) and pound lightly if needed. In a bowl, combine white wine, minced garlic, paprika, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Add the pork slices, ensuring they are well coated. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the marinated pork slices in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through. Remove cooked pork and set aside.

Pour the remaining marinade into the hot pan. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan, until slightly reduced and thickened. This will be the sauce.
Lightly toast the crusty rolls. Place several slices of cooked pork inside each roll. Spoon some of the pan sauce over the pork. Serve immediately, optionally with mustard or pickled vegetables.

recipes.title: Quick Breakfast Tostadas
recipes.description: Easy and flavorful breakfast tostadas with fried eggs, salsa, and fresh toppings. A perfect start to your day with a Mexican twist, ready in under 30 minutes.

steps.instruction: Prepare toppings: Dice the avocado, chop the fresh cilantro, and crumble the Cotija cheese. Set aside.

Warm tortillas: Heat olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Briefly fry each corn tortilla for 30-60 seconds per side until lightly crispy but still pliable. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Fry eggs: In the same skillet, fry the eggs to your desired doneness (sunny-side up or over easy are recommended). Season with salt and black pepper.
Assemble tostadas: Place two warm tortillas on each serving plate. Top each with a fried egg, a generous spoonful of salsa, diced avocado, chopped cilantro, and crumbled Cotija cheese.

recipes.title: Quick Caribbean Shrimp with Coconut Rice
recipes.description: A vibrant and flavorful Caribbean-inspired dish featuring succulent shrimp seasoned with a blend of spices, served alongside fragrant coconut rice. Perfect for a quick weeknight dinner.

steps.instruction: Rinse jasmine rice thoroughly under cold water until water runs clear. In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed rice, coconut milk, 1/2 cup water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Once boiling, reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan tightly, and simmer for 15 minutes until all liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Do not lift the lid during cooking.

While the rice cooks, pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. In a medium bowl, toss the shrimp with jerk seasoning and 1 tablespoon of fresh lime juice. Dice the red bell pepper and yellow onion, and mince the garlic.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the diced bell pepper and onion, and sauté for 3-4 minutes until they begin to soften. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add the seasoned shrimp to the skillet with the vegetables. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the shrimp turn pink and opaque. Be careful not to overcook, as shrimp can become rubbery.
Fluff the cooked coconut rice with a fork. Serve the quick Caribbean shrimp over the fragrant coconut rice, garnished with fresh chopped cilantro and extra lime wedges for squeezing.

recipes.title: Quick Chicken Tacos
recipes.description: Flavorful and easy-to-make chicken tacos, perfect for a busy weeknight dinner. Customize with your favorite toppings!

steps.instruction: Cut the chicken breasts into small strips or cubes. In a medium bowl, toss the chicken with the taco seasoning until evenly coated.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until fully cooked through and lightly browned. Stir occasionally.

While the chicken cooks, warm the corn tortillas. You can do this in a dry skillet over medium heat for 30 seconds per side, in the microwave wrapped in a damp paper towel for 30-60 seconds, or in the oven wrapped in foil.
Prepare your desired toppings: shred lettuce, dice tomatoes, and have cheese, sour cream, and salsa ready.
Assemble the tacos by spooning the cooked chicken into the warm tortillas. Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, shredded cheese, a dollop of sour cream, and a spoonful of salsa.

recipes.title: Quick Chicken Teriyaki Bowl
recipes.description: A delicious and easy-to-make Japanese chicken teriyaki bowl, perfect for a quick and satisfying lunch. Featuring tender chicken glazed in a savory-sweet sauce, served over fluffy rice.

steps.instruction: Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, grated ginger, and minced garlic in a small bowl. Whisk until the sugar is fully dissolved. Set aside.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces. Rinse the short-grain rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear.

Combine the rinsed rice and 3 cups of water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until all water is absorbed. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes off the heat.
While the rice cooks, heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 7 minutes.
Pour the prepared teriyaki sauce over the chicken. Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken, about 8 minutes.
Divide the cooked rice among four bowls. Top with the chicken teriyaki. Garnish with chopped green onions and toasted sesame seeds before serving.

recipes.title: Quick Chicken and Broccoli Stir-fry
recipes.description: A classic Chinese stir-fry dish featuring tender chicken, crisp broccoli, and a savory sauce, perfect for a weeknight dinner.

steps.instruction: Slice chicken breast into thin strips.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, chicken broth, cornstarch, sesame oil, and brown sugar until smooth. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from wok and set aside.
Add grated ginger and minced garlic to the wok, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add broccoli florets and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.

Return chicken to the wok. Give the prepared sauce a quick whisk again and pour it over the chicken and broccoli. Stir constantly until the sauce thickens and coats everything, about 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately, optionally with steamed rice.

recipes.title: Quick Greek Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing and easy Greek salad, perfect for a light and healthy lunch. This vibrant salad combines crisp vegetables, salty feta, and briny olives with a simple olive oil and red wine vinegar dressing.

steps.instruction: Wash and prepare all vegetables. Dice the cucumber, tomatoes, and green bell pepper. Thinly slice the red onion.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced cucumber, chopped tomatoes, sliced red onion, diced green bell pepper, and pitted Kalamata olives.
Prepare the dressing by whisking together the extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and freshly ground black pepper in a small bowl.
Pour the prepared dressing over the vegetables in the large bowl and toss gently to ensure all ingredients are well coated.
Gently crumble the feta cheese over the top of the salad.
Allow the salad to rest for 10 minutes before serving to let the flavors meld together. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Quick Indian Chicken Curry
recipes.description: A flavorful and aromatic Indian chicken curry that comes together in under 30 minutes, perfect for a weeknight dinner. Serve with rice or naan.

steps.instruction: Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces. Finely chop the onion. Prepare ginger-garlic paste if not using pre-made.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in curry powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder. Cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add the chicken pieces and salt. Sauté for 3-4 minutes until the chicken is lightly browned on all sides.
Pour in the tomato puree and coconut milk. Bring the curry to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro before serving.

recipes.title: Quick Korean Beef Bulgogi
recipes.description: A classic Korean dish featuring thinly sliced beef marinated in a savory-sweet sauce, then quickly stir-fried until tender and caramelized. Perfect for a weeknight dinner.

steps.instruction: Thinly slice the beef against the grain. In a large bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, grated Asian pear, and black pepper to create the marinade.

Add the sliced beef and thinly sliced yellow onion to the marinade. Toss well to ensure all pieces are evenly coated. Let marinate for at least 10 minutes at room temperature, or longer in the refrigerator if time permits.

Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the marinated beef and onions in a single layer (cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding the pan). Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the beef is cooked through, tender, and slightly caramelized.
Transfer the cooked bulgogi to a serving platter. Garnish generously with chopped green onions and toasted sesame seeds. Serve immediately with steamed rice and kimchi.

ingredients.name: Beef sirloin or ribeye, thinly sliced

recipes.title: Quick Misir Wot (Ethiopian Red Lentil Stew)
recipes.description: A flavorful and quick Ethiopian red lentil stew, rich with berbere spice and aromatic onions, perfect for a satisfying weeknight dinner. Best served with injera or rice.

steps.instruction: Rinse the red lentils thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Set aside.

Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 5-7 minutes. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the berbere spice blend and tomato paste. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, allowing the spices to toast and the tomato paste to deepen in color.
Add the rinsed lentils and water (or vegetable broth) to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the lentils are tender and have absorbed most of the liquid, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. The stew should be thick.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve hot with injera, rice, or flatbread.

recipes.title: Quick Moroccan Spiced Chicken with Couscous
recipes.description: A vibrant and aromatic Moroccan-inspired chicken dish, featuring tender chicken breast seasoned with a blend of traditional spices, served alongside fluffy couscous. This recipe is designed for a flavorful weeknight dinner that comes together in just 30 minutes.

steps.instruction: Dice the chicken breast into 1-inch cubes. Chop the onion and mince the garlic. In a small bowl, combine the ground cumin, coriander, smoked paprika, turmeric, and cinnamon.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat. Add the chicken cubes and cook until lightly browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. Add the chopped onion to the same skillet and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in the minced garlic and the prepared spice mixture, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.

Return the browned chicken to the skillet. Pour in the chicken broth and canned diced tomatoes (undrained). Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and cook for 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld and the chicken to cook through. While the chicken simmers, prepare the couscous: bring 200ml of water to a boil, stir in the 200g of couscous, cover, remove from heat, and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff the cooked couscous with a fork.
Stir the fresh chopped parsley and lemon juice into the chicken mixture. Serve the Moroccan spiced chicken immediately over the fluffy couscous.

recipes.title: Quick Polish Sausage and Cabbage Skillet
recipes.description: A simple and hearty one-pan meal featuring smoked kielbasa, tender cabbage, and sweet onions, perfect for a quick and satisfying weeknight dinner with a Polish-inspired flavor.

steps.instruction: Prepare all ingredients: slice kielbasa into 1/2-inch rounds, core and shred the cabbage, dice the onion, and mince the garlic.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the sliced kielbasa and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes. Remove the kielbasa from the skillet and set aside.
Add the diced onion to the same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and translucent, about 3-4 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.

Stir in the shredded cabbage, chicken broth, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the skillet, and cook until the cabbage is tender, about 8 minutes, stirring once halfway through.
Return the cooked kielbasa to the skillet. Stir in the Dijon mustard and cook for another 1-2 minutes to heat everything through. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Quick Swedish Pyttipanna
recipes.description: A beloved Swedish classic, Pyttipanna is a savory hash made from diced potatoes, onions, and leftover cooked meat (traditionally ham or sausage). It's quick to prepare and makes for a hearty and satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Dice the peeled potatoes, yellow onion, and cooked ham into small, even cubes. This ensures even cooking.

Heat the butter in a large frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the diced potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are tender and lightly browned, which usually takes about 10-12 minutes.
Add the diced onion and ham to the pan with the potatoes. Continue to cook, stirring, until the onion is softened and translucent, and the ham is heated through and slightly crispy, about 8 minutes.
Season the pyttipanna generously with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Stir well to combine all the ingredients.
Serve the Quick Swedish Pyttipanna immediately. Traditionally, it's topped with a fried egg and served with a side of pickled beetroot.

recipes.title: Smashed Avo & Poached Eggs
recipes.description: A classic Australian breakfast featuring creamy smashed avocado on toasted sourdough, topped with perfectly poached eggs and a sprinkle of chili flakes. Simple, fresh, and satisfying.

steps.instruction: Halve, pit, and scoop the avocado flesh into a medium bowl. Add lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. Mash with a fork until you reach your desired consistency.
Toast the sourdough bread slices until golden brown and crispy.
Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer. Carefully crack each egg into a small bowl, then gently slide into the simmering water. Cook for 3-4 minutes for runny yolks.
Spread the smashed avocado generously over each slice of toasted sourdough.
Carefully remove poached eggs with a slotted spoon and place one on top of each avocado toast.
Season with a pinch more salt and pepper, a drizzle of olive oil, and a sprinkle of chili flakes if desired. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Smørrebrød with Cream Cheese and Radishes
recipes.description: A simple and refreshing Scandinavian open-faced sandwich featuring crisp radishes, fresh dill, and creamy cheese on rye bread. Perfect for a light breakfast or brunch.

steps.instruction: Wash and thinly slice the radishes.
Wash and finely chop the fresh dill.
Spread cream cheese evenly on each slice of rye bread.
Arrange the sliced radishes over the cream cheese.
Sprinkle chopped dill, salt, and black pepper over the radishes. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Spanish Garlic Shrimp (Gambas al Ajillo)
recipes.description: A classic Spanish tapas dish featuring succulent shrimp cooked in olive oil with plenty of garlic and a hint of chili flakes. Perfect as an appetizer or a light dinner served with crusty bread.

steps.instruction: Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. Season them generously with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet or cazuela, heat the olive oil over medium-low heat. Add the sliced garlic and red pepper flakes.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is fragrant and lightly golden. Do not let it brown or burn.
Increase the heat to medium-high. Add the seasoned shrimp to the skillet in a single layer. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until the shrimp turn pink and opaque.
Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir in the fresh chopped parsley. Serve immediately with lemon wedges and crusty bread for dipping in the flavorful oil.

recipes.title: Spicy Miso Chicken Ramen Bowl
recipes.description: A hearty and flavorful Japanese-inspired ramen bowl featuring tender chicken, rich miso broth, and fresh vegetables. Perfect for a satisfying lunch that's packed with umami and a kick of spice.

steps.instruction: Slice chicken breast into thin strips. Mince garlic and grate fresh ginger. Slice green onions for garnish.
Heat sesame oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add chicken strips and sauté until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside.

In the same pot, add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Pour in chicken broth, soy sauce, white miso paste, and chili garlic sauce. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, stirring to dissolve the miso paste.
While the broth simmers, cook ramen noodles according to package instructions. Separately, soft-boil eggs for 6-7 minutes, then peel and halve them.

Divide cooked ramen noodles among 4 serving bowls. Ladle the hot miso broth over the noodles. Arrange the cooked chicken, baby spinach, and halved soft-boiled eggs on top of each bowl. Garnish generously with sliced green onions.

recipes.title: Spicy Thai Cucumber Salad (Som Tum Tang)
recipes.description: A refreshing and vibrant Thai cucumber salad with a spicy, tangy, and sweet dressing. Perfect for a light lunch or side dish, bursting with authentic flavors. Easy to make and customize.

steps.instruction: Prepare the vegetables: julienne cucumbers, halve cherry tomatoes, and trim green beans. Mince garlic and thinly slice chili.
In a large mortar and pestle (or a sturdy bowl), lightly bruise the minced garlic and sliced chilies. Add the green beans and lightly bruise them as well.

Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar to the mortar/bowl. Mix well until the sugar dissolves completely. Add the julienned cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, and half of the roasted peanuts. Gently toss to combine all ingredients.
Let the salad sit for 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Garnish with the remaining roasted peanuts just before serving.

recipes.title: Spicy Thai Peanut Noodles with Chicken
recipes.description: A vibrant and flavorful dish featuring tender chicken, rice noodles, and crisp vegetables tossed in a rich, spicy peanut sauce. Perfect for a quick and satisfying lunch with a kick.

steps.instruction: Cook rice noodles according to package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water to prevent sticking, and set aside.

In a medium bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, minced garlic, grated ginger, sesame oil, and chili garlic sauce until smooth. If the sauce is too thick, add 1-2 tablespoons of warm water.

Heat 1 tablespoon of cooking oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken strips and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Add red bell pepper and carrots to the same skillet. Sauté for 3-5 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp. If needed, add a splash of water to deglaze the pan.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet with the vegetables. Add the cooked and drained rice noodles and pour the peanut sauce over everything. Toss well to coat all ingredients evenly.
Serve immediately, garnished with chopped green onions, fresh cilantro, and roasted peanuts.

recipes.title: Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai)
recipes.description: A quick and flavorful Thai stir-fry featuring ground chicken, aromatic holy basil, and a savory sauce, perfect for a satisfying weeknight dinner. Ready in under 30 minutes!

steps.instruction: Mince the garlic and slice the Thai chilies. In a small bowl, whisk together the fish sauce, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar to create the sauce.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and sliced chilies; stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the ground chicken to the wok. Break it up with a spoon and stir-fry until it is browned and cooked through, which should take about 5-7 minutes.
Pour the prepared sauce mixture over the cooked chicken and stir well to combine. Add the holy basil leaves and continue to stir-fry until the basil is wilted, about 1-2 minutes.
Serve the Thai Basil Chicken immediately over hot jasmine rice.

recipes.title: Thai Green Curry with Chicken
recipes.description: A classic, aromatic Thai green curry featuring tender chicken, crisp bamboo shoots, and vibrant bell peppers, all simmered in a rich, fragrant coconut milk sauce. This dish offers a perfect balance of spicy, sweet, and savory flavors, ideal for a satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: Cut chicken breast into bite-sized pieces. Slice the red bell pepper and drain/slice the canned bamboo shoots. Have all ingredients ready for cooking.
Heat a wok or large pot over medium heat. Add the green curry paste and stir-fry for 2 minutes until very fragrant.
Add the chicken pieces to the wok and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned on all sides, about 4 minutes.
Pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer. Stir in the fish sauce, palm sugar, kaffir lime leaves, sliced red bell pepper, and drained bamboo shoots.
Continue to simmer for 8 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender-crisp. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Remove the wok from the heat and stir in the fresh basil leaves until just wilted.
Serve the Thai Green Curry hot, ideally with a side of steamed jasmine rice.

recipes.title: Traditional Japanese Breakfast Set
recipes.description: Enjoy a balanced and authentic Japanese breakfast featuring fluffy rice, savory miso soup, grilled salmon, and a delicate tamagoyaki. A perfect start to your day.

steps.instruction: Wash rice thoroughly until water runs clear. Soak rice in 2.5 cups of water for 30 minutes.
Cook rice in a rice cooker or pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
Marinate salmon fillets with soy sauce, mirin, and sake for at least 15 minutes.
Preheat broiler or grill. Cook salmon for 5-7 minutes per side, until cooked through and lightly browned.
In a saucepan, bring dashi stock to a gentle simmer. Add cubed tofu and rehydrated wakame. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Remove a small amount of dashi broth, dissolve miso paste in it, then return to the pot. Do not boil after adding miso.
Whisk eggs with sugar and salt.

Heat a non-stick pan (preferably a rectangular tamagoyaki pan) with a little vegetable oil over medium-low heat. Pour a thin layer of egg mixture, let it set slightly, then roll it to one side. Add more egg mixture, lifting the rolled egg to let it flow underneath. Repeat until all egg mixture is used, forming a layered omelet. Slice into pieces.
Serve each portion with a bowl of rice, a piece of grilled salmon, a bowl of miso soup, sliced tamagoyaki, and a sheet of nori seaweed.

recipes.title: Turkish Kebab Plate
recipes.description: A classic Turkish kebab plate featuring juicy marinated lamb or beef, served with fluffy rice, fresh salad, and warm pita bread. This satisfying lunch offers a taste of the Mediterranean.

steps.instruction: In a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper. Add the cubed lamb or beef and toss to coat. Marinate for at least 20 minutes at room temperature, or up to 4 hours in the refrigerator.

While the meat marinates, prepare the rice. Rinse 1 cup of basmati rice thoroughly. In a saucepan, combine rice and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-18 minutes, or until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Fluff with a fork.
Prepare the salad by combining diced cucumber, diced tomato, thinly sliced red onion, and chopped fresh parsley in a small bowl. Toss gently.

Heat a grill or a large pan over medium-high heat. Thread the marinated meat onto skewers (if using) or cook directly in the pan. Cook for 3-5 minutes per side, or until desired doneness is reached and the meat is nicely browned.
Warm the pita bread briefly on the grill, in a dry pan, or in the microwave. Assemble the plates by serving the cooked kebab alongside the fluffy rice, fresh salad, and warm pita bread.

recipes.title: Turkish Menemen (Scrambled Eggs with Tomatoes & Peppers)
recipes.description: A classic Turkish breakfast featuring scrambled eggs cooked with fresh tomatoes, green peppers, and onions. Simple, flavorful, and perfect for a hearty start to your day.

steps.instruction: Dice the tomatoes, green bell peppers, and finely chop the onion. Whisk the eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large non-stick pan or skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until softened, about 3-5 minutes. Add the green bell peppers and cook for another 5-7 minutes until tender.
Stir in the diced tomatoes and red pepper flakes (if using). Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes break down and a sauce forms.
Pour the whisked eggs into the pan with the vegetables. Stir gently until the eggs are just set but still moist. Do not overcook.
Remove from heat. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley. Serve immediately with crusty bread.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls (Goi Cuon)
recipes.description: A light and refreshing Vietnamese classic with shrimp, pork, vermicelli, and fresh herbs, perfect for a healthy meal. Served with a savory peanut dipping sauce.

steps.instruction: Cook shrimp and pork if not pre-cooked; slice pork thinly and halve shrimp lengthwise. Cook vermicelli noodles according to package directions, then drain and rinse with cold water. Wash and thoroughly dry lettuce, mint, and cilantro.
Prepare the peanut dipping sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, hoisin sauce, lime juice, water, and minced garlic until smooth. Add more water if a thinner consistency is desired.

Fill a shallow dish or pie plate with warm water. Dip one rice paper wrapper into the water for 15-20 seconds until it becomes soft and pliable. Lay the softened wrapper flat on a clean, damp surface.

Arrange a few lettuce leaves, a small handful of vermicelli noodles, a few mint and cilantro leaves, 2-3 shrimp halves, and a few slices of pork near the bottom edge of the wrapper. Fold the bottom edge of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides. Tightly roll the wrapper from the bottom upwards, creating a firm spring roll. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.
Serve the fresh spring rolls immediately with the prepared peanut dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Lemongrass Chicken Noodle Salad (Bun Ga Nuong)
recipes.description: A refreshing and flavorful Vietnamese noodle salad featuring tender grilled lemongrass chicken, crisp fresh vegetables, and delicate vermicelli noodles, all tossed in a tangy and savory nuoc cham dressing. Perfect for a light yet satisfying lunch.

steps.instruction: In a bowl, combine sliced chicken thighs with 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, minced lemongrass, and 1 minced garlic clove. Mix well and let marinate for at least 10 minutes while you prepare other ingredients.
Cook vermicelli noodles according to package instructions, usually by soaking in hot water for 5-7 minutes until tender, then drain and rinse with cold water to prevent sticking. Set aside.

While noodles cook, prepare the nuoc cham dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons fish sauce, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 3 tablespoons lime juice, 2 tablespoons rice vinegar, 4 tablespoons water, 2 minced garlic cloves, and sliced chili (if using). Taste and adjust sweetness/sourness to your preference.

Heat a grill pan or large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the marinated chicken slices for 3-4 minutes per side, or until cooked through and slightly charred. Remove from heat and slice into bite-sized pieces if not already.

Assemble the salads: Divide shredded lettuce, cooked vermicelli noodles, julienned cucumber, and julienned carrot among 4 serving bowls. Top with the cooked lemongrass chicken, fresh mint leaves, and fresh cilantro. Drizzle generously with the prepared nuoc cham dressing and sprinkle with chopped roasted peanuts.
